title: Revise "about" page

repository.name: tudat-space
repository.description: An introduction and guide to tudat-space.

body:
This is a follow-up from #21 and it concerns this [page](https://tudat-space.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_src_about/about.html).

The page should be split in 4 different subpages (in parenthesis, you see who I think are the most suitable people to draft these pages - what I need is content, even in the form of word documents, while I can fix the style itself if needed):

- [x] history of the project (@DominicDirkx)
- [x] roadmap + ongoing activities (@DominicDirkx @geoffreygarrett)
- [x] success stories (@DominicDirkx - presenting in more detail a selection of the current list of papers + the full list as it is should suffice)
- [x] core team + past contributors (@FilippoOggionni)

title: Start using proper versioning for the conda package

repository.name: tudat-bundle
repository.description: A developers repository for the tudat environment.

body:
The version number of the conda package that is shared should be incremented automatically (0.5.22 -> 0.5.23 for the next build for instance).
At each more important update, increment the second digit (0.5.22 -> 0.6.0 for instance).

This makes it cleaner to discuss/ensure what version of the packages students and users are running.

title: Ensure readthedocs build fails if build.sh fails
body: @ggarrett13 I will let you elaborate more on the issue, because I am not familiar with it 🙂

title: Investigate autocomplete on PyCharm and stubs files

repository.name: tudatpy
repository.description: A Python platform to perform astrodynamics and space research.

body:
Original issue was [there](https://github.com/tudat-team/project-management/issues/2). 

Resource: https://tudat.slack.com/archives/D01GSTLQT1S/p1620138100040900
(private chat between @ggarrett13 and @FilippoOggionni)

Back to pybind auto-generated stubs
I have looked into pybind11 options, specifically the options.disable_function_signatures() that you talked about in the thread. Unfortunately, it is not something that I can (yet) try out locally, but I hope I will be able to do it soon.
In summary, you say that the option of pybind11 auto-generated is not convenient for the following two reasons:
It is superfluous with function signatures: e.g., we would ideally like BodyListSettings instead of tudatpy.kernel.simulation.environment_setup.BodyListSettings (on a side note, is the length of the string an issue only for the autogenerated docs?);
more importantly, it cannot deal with overloaded functions.
For problem 2, I think there is a solution. Perhaps it is not automatic with pybind11 autogen stubs, but it uses MyPy (see this message and the related link). You can have a look at this (5th bullet point), but also this one (I did not fully understand the differences between the two, so if you catch them please feel free to lecture me haha). Shall we give it a try?
For problem 1, I am not sure if there is a solution, but it does not seem that it is the main limiting problem. Also, are we gonna use these stubs to build the tudatpy API? In addition, something that I was thinking about is that the option options.disable_function_signatures() is set only on the highest-level pybind module (here). From pybind docs (here), it seems that this option works at a module level. Does it work hierarchically? In other words, what happens if you disable the function signature at a higher level but leave it on at a lower level? Which one of the two dominates? I assume the higher level, but if I am wrong it could be a workaround for problem 1.

title: Adding webpages to tudat-space (from legacy content)

repository.name: tudat-space
repository.description: An introduction and guide to tudat-space.

body:
There were a number of pages on tudat-space which were only in the "idea" phase, i.e., they only had a title. For now, I removed them, because they did not look good, but I will note them down here so we can keep track of them. Please let me know which one you would like to see on the tudat-space at some point in the future and which one can be discarded.

- [ ] Contributing to tudat-space (I think this can be solved by adding some information to [this](https://github.com/tudat-team/tudat-space/blob/master/docs/source/_src_about/documentation.rst) page)

- [ ]  Roadmap for tudat-space (probably better to add it [here](https://github.com/tudat-team/tudat-space/blob/master/docs/source/_src_about/about.rst))

- [ ] Visualization of results (probably better to add an extra page in [this](https://github.com/tudat-team/tudat-space/tree/master/docs/source/_src_resources) directory)

- [ ] This stuff (previously on the main page):

    - Indices and tables:
```
       * :ref: `genindex`
       * :ref:`modindex`
       * :ref:`search`
```

title: Developer documentation

repository.name: tudat-space
repository.description: An introduction and guide to tudat-space.

body:
Currently finishing off a developer specific documentation with the following topics:

````
- CMake 
- Pybind
- Sphinx documentation
- Conda tools
````

Currently aiming for a deadline: 1st of May.

title: Linux build failing with boost 1.70+

repository.name: tudat
repository.description: A C++ platform to perform astrodynamics and space research.

body:
Likely to do with `_GLIBCXX_USE_CXX11_ABI` and the boost build supplied on anaconda.org.
- [1.70 Azure log](https://dev.azure.com/tudat-team/feedstock-builds/_build/results?buildId=167&view=logs&j=4f922444-fdfe-5dcf-b824-02f86439ef14)
- [1.71 Azure log](https://dev.azure.com/tudat-team/feedstock-builds/_build/results?buildId=167&view=logs&j=517fe804-fa30-5dc2-1413-330699242c05&t=c10fa5f2-fdf6-5338-3bdb-c4bea7c23412)

title: Failing tests for Clang build on Windows using MSVC libraries

repository.name: tudat
repository.description: A C++ platform to perform astrodynamics and space research.

body:
The tests fail due to tolerances in tests being exceeded. This must be resolved, but for now these tests will be omitted from the feedstock releases in the `YOLO/YOLOAddTestCase.cmake` file (on `tudat/develop` branch), in order to meet deadlines for Numerical Astrodynamics. 

```
The following tests FAILED:
         12 - test_basic_astro_OrbitalElementConversions (Failed)
         21 - test_basic_astro_TimeConversions (Failed)
         26 - test_basic_astro_SphericalOrbitStateConversions (Failed)
         70 - test_shape_based_HodographicShaping (Failed)
         92 - test_orbit_determination_EstimationInput (Failed)
         95 - test_orbit_determination_HybridArcStateEstimation (Failed)
        142 - test_propagators_VariationalEquations (Failed)
        160 - test_basics_TimeTypes (Failed)
        221 - test_io_MultiArrayReader (Failed)
Errors while running CTest
```

Either we change the tolerances or determine why occurs with MSVC libraries compiled with Clang.
